intro: Sphaerostephanos peltochlamys, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green floral structures. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its flowers are notable for their star-shaped appearance and vibrant coloration, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The botanical features of Sphaerostephanos peltochlamys make it a unique and visually appealing species within the orchid family.
